Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of horse harnessing scene (muzzle and neck of horse and a right hand on bridle remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Harnessing to the left is unusual, and the objects in the 'background' unclear. Is the head turned back?
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 255, no. B165)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0084) (Phase 1)
